profile_positions.description:
Studio Europa is a centre of expertise for Europe-related debate and research founded in 2018 by the Maastricht, Working on Europe partners: Maastricht University, the Province of Limburg and the City of Maastricht.  

We aim to position Maastricht as a meeting place for citizen dialogue and debate and focus on three pillars: 

Academic research:
We are a leading centre for multi-disciplinary Europe-focused research with societal impact.

European heritage:
We bring the legacy of the Maastricht Treaty, since 2018 proud holder of the European Heritage Label, to life.

Public debate:
We stimulate active, critical debate with engagement at its core and capture and share the stories of Europe.

www.studioeuropamaastricht.nl/
profile_positions.title: Director Studio Europa Maastricht

profile_positions.description:
The UM Student Desk is divided in two branches: UM Admissions & International Services and Professional & Personal Development. The first branch consists of the administrative teams UM Admissions, UM International Services Desk and team Bekostiging. The second branch consists of the student guidance teams of UM Psychologists, UM Student Deans and UM career Services. 

The UM Student Desks consists of 48 staff members and 20 student assistants and is located at the Student Services Centre. The department is responsible for the quality and efficiency of the services to all new and current (inter)national students (i.e., 17.000 in total) in regards to admission, registration, professional development and student guidance. In other words, we are a central welcome point for UM's student community, answering around 90.000 questions yearly at our front office and in our call center. We have a special focus on offering adequate internationals services to UM's diverse student population (e.g., visa and scholarship matters, international peer-to-peer support, pick-up services). We work for and with our students to strengthen their personal and professional well-being and their (legal) empowerment together with our UM psychologists, student deans and career counselors. We also offer a central complaint service point, a UM disability support desk and take care of UM wide exam logistics. 

Selection of responsibilities as Head of Department: Formulate the strategical and tactical goals, while anticipating upcoming developments and innovations. Manage and coach the team leaders and their team members. Supervise on results and KPI's and guarantee a timely, high quality and efficient process management. Budget holder. Act as a representative spokesperson to our relevant stakeholders (e.g., students, Faculties, CvB, DUO, Nuffic, VSNU).
profile_positions.title: Head UM Student Desk: UM Admissions & International Services and Professional & Personal Development

profile_positions.description:
The Department of Data Science and Knowledge Engineering (DKE) offers a three-year bachelor's program in Knowledge Engineering and two two-year master's programs in Artificial Intelligence and Operations Research. DKE is part of the Faculty of Science and Engineering, previously known as the Faculty of Humanities and Sciences up to 2018). 

Our research is organized in three research groups: "BioMathematics and BioInformatics"​ (BMI), "Robots, Agents and Interaction"​ (RAI) and "Networks and Strategic Optimization" (NSO). Department members involved in multiple research groups enhance interaction between the groups. DKE consist of approximately 45 scientific and 10 support staff members. 

As Department Manager and Board Member I take care of HR, finance, strategy and organization of the Department. Selection of responsibilities: Manage and support OBP and WP personnel. Contribute to the strategic department plan of DKE and support the scientific head. Formulate policy notes, supervise on department plans and results, and monitor policy implementation. Budget holder. Advisor to the PR team. Prepare, organize and lead visits from external delegations (e.g., partner Universities, NVAO visitation- and accreditation procedures). FHS broad responsibilities: Faculty representative Student Affairs, HBO chair key-users admissions, Faculty representative UM scholarship committee, Faculty representative during UM institutional assessment (ITK).  

www.maastrichtuniversity.nl/dke
profile_positions.title: Manager - Department Data Science and Knowledge Engineering @ Maastricht University

profile_positions.description: The Academic Leadership Programme (ALP) is a broad professional development programme for Maastricht University's leaders. The ALP aims to support sound and continuous development of leadership competences. The ALP focuses on three groups of managers: upper management (Mastering Peaks), middle management (Oxygen) and budding talent (Steep Face). Participants in Steep Face are selected and considered suitable for taking on leadership roles within the organisation. ALP Steep Face is seen as a stepping stone, and high Potentials may eventually develop towards the Oxygen/Mastering Peaks programmes as they become more experienced managers.
profile_positions.title: High Potential @Academic Leadership Programme of Maastricht University (ALP-Steep Face & Oxygen)

profile_positions.description:
The Department of Data Science and Knowledge Engineering (DKE) offers a three-year bachelor's program in Knowledge Engineering and two two-year master's programs in Artificial Intelligence and Operations Research. DKE is part of the Faculty of Science and Engineering, previously known as the Faculty of Humanities and Sciences up to 2018). 

Selection of Responsibilities as Head of The Student Affairs Office: Supervising on results, planning, service quality of the Student Affairs Office, student coaching & study advising, Faculty scholarships representative, international relations, programme development, policy development, examination board, master classes on (Personal) leadership and team dynamics, Management, budget and HR.

profile_positions.description:
Curator and primary licensee of the TEDxMaastricht initiative: The TEDx programme is designed to help communities, organisations and individuals to spark conversation and connection through local TED-like experiences. 

I had the pleasure to coordinate the TEDxMaastricht team of volunteers during the preparation and execution of TEDxMaastricht events. I took care of the content curation of our events, offered public speaking masterclasses and coaching and gave our speakers a platform for identifying and disseminating ideas worth spreading. As licensee, I was spokesperson of TEDxMaastricht within the wider TED community. I worked closely with the board of the TEDxMaastricht foundation who are responsible for (financial) administration and maintaining a strong regional network of partners (e.g., Province, Municipality, Maastricht University, LED, DSM, Brightlands, MUMC+, Vodafone, Chemelot, Sabic, Vebego, etc). 

Twitter: @TEDxMaastricht 
Facebook https://www.facebook.com/TEDxMaastricht
http://tedxmaastricht.nl/
profile_positions.title: Primary Licensee @TEDxMaastricht
